prefix: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would.
problem_prompt: Approach the following question the way someone with a PhD in mathematics would. It is currently $3\!:\!00\!:\!00 \text{ p.m.}$ What time will it be in $6666$ seconds?  (Enter the time in the format "HH:MM:SS", without including "am" or "pm".)
solution: There are $60$ seconds in a minute. When $6666$ is divided by $60$, you get $111$ with a remainder of $6$ seconds. Therefore, $6666$ seconds is $111$ minutes and $6$ seconds. There are $60$ minutes in an hour. When you divide $111$ by $60$, you get $1$ with a remainder of $51$. Thus, $6666$ seconds is equivalent to $1$ hour $51$ minutes and $6$ seconds. Therefore, the time in $6666$ seconds is $\boxed{4\!:\!51\!:\!06 \text{ p.m.}}$
gpt_response:
Let us first determine how many seconds are in an hour: $60$ seconds in a minute $\times 60$ minutes in an hour $= 3600$ seconds in an hour.

Since $6666$ is greater than $3600$ but less than $7200$, we know that the time will not change by more than one hour.

After $3600$ seconds, the time will be $4\!:\!00\!:\!00 \text{ p.m.}$. 

Therefore, after an additional $6666 - 3600 = 3066$ seconds have passed, the time will be $4\!:\!51\!:\!06$. 

Thus, the time will be $\boxed{04:51:06}$.
solution_prompt:
The following is a response to a question. Yes or no, is the final solution obtained in the following response 4\!:\!51\!:\!06 \text{ p.m.?: Let us first determine how many seconds are in an hour: $60$ seconds in a minute $\times 60$ minutes in an hour $= 3600$ seconds in an hour.

Since $6666$ is greater than $3600$ but less than $7200$, we know that the time will not change by more than one hour.

After $3600$ seconds, the time will be $4\!:\!00\!:\!00 \text{ p.m.}$. 

Therefore, after an additional $6666 - 3600 = 3066$ seconds have passed, the time will be $4\!:\!51\!:\!06$. 

Thus, the time will be $\boxed{04:51:06}$.
